pass something ↔ up.translation[0].defin: to not make use of a chance to do something
I don’t think you should pass up the opportunity to go to university.
pass something ↔ up.translation[1].defin: to not use the chance etc to do or have something when it is offered
You wonder, when you pass up a deal like that, whether you’ll ever get one again.
Even careful consumers are finding these bargains too good to pass up.
